content.description: This route goes right of the J-Crack on the face up to a vertical face with some awesome jugs. The face is a little balancy with some little slopers and crimpers then the vertical half of the climb has some really good jugs.
content.protection: There are chain anchors on top. Bring 2 draws or a sling to hang over edge to make TRing easier.
content.location: The route is located right of the J-Crack on the face. Once you find the face you will see a little peninsula sticking out, the anchors are on top of it.

content.description: This is a nice an easy climb for people who like cracks and are getting into leading trad.  The rock is faily solid and takes pro pretty easy.
content.protection: Medium to Large Nuts and Hexes and Cams woudl work great too.
content.location: Up the hill from the Vegan Boulder to the Left.  The route is about 5 minutes from the vegan boulder.

content.description: This route goes up logans first 5.4, then there is a sharpe arete climb on the left of this arete, up the face. There are good holds and the route is quite a bit overhanging.
content.protection: There are chain anchors on top for top roping, But bring a few draws or a sling to hang over edge to make top roping easier.
content.location: Once you find the J-crack go left about 10 feet and there is another crack. Climb up this, then once you get to the arete stay on the left side and to the top.

content.description: This route was named after all the bird poo i spent three days scraping off with a brush. This route goes up a face with about four horizontal cracks then a really good mono up to a roof. then about a five move crux.
content.protection: A cold shut Anchor and a chain anchor at top
content.location: This route is to the left of the J crack about 100 feet up a white streak.

content.description: This climb is a basic climb just like the others in this area such as the Unnamed route. Good holds if you are learning.
content.protection: There are 2 sets of anchors. Fixed chains for setting up a top rope on each of the 2 sets.
content.location: To get to the route follow the road Up from the Settlers Boulder on M Hill in Rapid City. The climb will come into view in about 1 minute after passing the Settlers Boulder and will be on the right. These 2 routes are close to each other right about 20' of Unamed 5.4

content.description: Climb the lower section next to the small roof/cave to gain the upper portion. Pump through a steep overhang on jugs and then top it out for a nice little challenge. This route probably has a different name, but this will be its temporary one.
content.protection: Two anchor bolts with no chains. Bring long slings/cord to extend an anchor over the edge.
content.location: Park at Founder's Park. Cross the bridge to Vegan boulder. Follow the gravel road up the where it turns to a path on the right. Follow the path or cut across to the sandstone wall with faded words printed on it. The route begins about 30 ft left of J-crack next to a small cave/roof. Scramble up the gap in the wall to the left to find the anchors up top.

content.description: Not sure if this route has a name or not, but this is its temporary name. Start near the big pocket a couple feet left of "J crack." Face climb up good pockets, trending left to the arete. Climb the right side of the arete to the anchors. Shares anchors with "Round House and Running." Watch for wasp nests in the some of the deeper pockets.
content.protection: Two anchors up top with no chains. Bring long slings/cord to build a TR anchor.
content.location: Park at Founder's Park. Walk across the bridge near Vegan and head up the gravel road until a path branches off on the right. Follow the path or cut across up the hill to the base of the sandstone wall with the worn words printed on it. To find the anchors, walk to the left a little and scramble up a little gap to reach the top of the wall. The anchors are off the edge a little, so use caution when rigging the TR.

content.description: This is a fairly decent short crack that offers very good introduction to leading trad at an easy level.  The rock quality is fair and the crack takes pro just about anywhere.  I found that the crack can be well protected by medium to large hexes or cams.  There is also a large tree at the top of the climb that can be slung for top rope.
